Module jGame
Package jGame.core.sound

Class SoundStore

java.lang.Object
jGame.core.sound.SoundStore
public class SoundStore
extends java.lang.Object
A sound bank to store all the audio data used by a game.
Since:
2.0.0
Author:
Nuno Pereira

  • Method Details

    • initiated

      public static boolean initiated()
      Returns weather the sound bank has been initialized.
      Returns:
      weather the sound bank has been initialized
      Since:
      2.0.0

    • init

      public static void init​(java.lang.String audioResources)
      Initialize the sound bank by checking the classpath for an "audio" folder. Because of some limitations with reading the classpath for files, the user must provide a list with the names of the resources they wish to load.
      Parameters:
      audioResources - a comma separated list of the audio resources to load
      Since:
      2.0.0

    • cacheSound

      public static void cacheSound​(java.lang.String soundIdentifier, byte[] soundData, javax.sound.sampled.AudioFormat format)
      Stores the given audio data in this audio bank.
      Parameters:
      soundIdentifier - the identifier to use when addressing the given sound
      soundData - the actual sound data of the sound to cache
      format - the format of the sound data
      Since:
      2.0.0

    • cacheSound

      private static void cacheSound​(java.lang.String soundIdentifier, Tuple audio)

    • getSound

      public static byte[] getSound​(java.lang.String soundIdentifier)
      Returns the sound data referred to by the given identifier.
      Parameters:
      soundIdentifier - of the sound
      Returns:
      the byte data of the sound to play, or null if there is no sound with the given identifier
      Since:
      2.0.0

    • getFormat

      public static javax.sound.sampled.AudioFormat getFormat​(java.lang.String soundIdentifier)
      Returns the format of the sound data referred to by the given identifier.
      Parameters:
      soundIdentifier - the identifier of the sound
      Returns:
      the format of the specified audio data, or null if there is no sound with the given identifier
      Since:
      2.0.0

    • getDataStream

      private static java.net.URL getDataStream​(java.lang.String resource)
